paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is satisfied by any representations made to him by or on behalf of the owner or demise charterer within the period that it would be inappropriate to close the ship’s registration.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the end of the period referred to in subsection (1), the Registrar shall close the ship’s registration unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified fee or charge is paid within that period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is satisfied by any representations made pursuant to that subsection that it would be inappropriate to close the ship’s registration.

subsection.content: The Registrar may exercise the power to close the ship’s registration vested in him by subsection (2) whether or not legal proceedings are brought against any person for recovery of the fee or charge.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Closure on failure of representative person to act, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where in relation to a registered ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the representative person appointed in relation to the ship (being the owner of the ship) has failed to comply with section 71(1) or with any other obligation imposed on him by this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears to the Director that the owner or demise charterer has failed to comply with section 68(1)(b) or (3) or with a notice served on the owner or demise charterer under section 72(1) within the time specified in that section,

subsection.continued: then, whether or not—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: legal proceedings are brought against the owner, demise charterer or representative person in respect of any such failure to comply; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the ship ceases to be registrable,

subsection.continued: the Director may direct the Registrar to close the registration of the ship.

subsection.content: Upon receipt of a direction under subsection (1) the Registrar shall record the giving of the direction in the register and the ship’s registration shall thereupon be closed.

Without prejudice to sections 60, 61 and 63, if for any reason it appears to the Registrar that a registered ship may have ceased to be registrable, he may by notice served on the owner, demise charterer or representative person require that person to furnish him with such information as he thinks necessary for the purpose of determining whether the ship is registrable.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar has served a notice under subsection (1) with respect to a ship, then, unless he has become satisfied that the ship is registrable, he shall, as soon as practicable after the end of the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of that notice, serve a notice under subsection (4) on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner, demise charterer or representative person appointed in relation to the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each mortgagee (if any) of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Director is satisfied in relation to a registered ship—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that any penalty imposed on the owner or demise charterer of the ship in respect of a contravention of or failure to comply with any provision of this Ordinance or any Ordinance specified in Schedule 2 has remained unpaid for a period of more than 3 months and no appeal against the penalty is pending; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that any summons for any such contravention or failure to comply has been duly served on the owner, demise charterer or representative person of the ship but the owner or demise charterer failed to appear at the time and place appointed for the trial of the information or complaint in question and a period of not less than 3 months has elapsed since that time,

subsection.continued: the Director shall serve a notice under subsection (4) on—

paragraph.content: the owner, demise charterer or representative person; and
each mortgagee (if any) of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under this subsection is a notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Director is not satisfied that the ship in question is registrable or (as the case may be) that he is satisfied as to the matters specified in subsection (3)(a), (b) or (c), as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that he intends, after the end of the period of 90 days beginning with the date of service of the notice, to direct that the ship’s registration be closed unless he is satisfied that it would be inappropriate to do so by any representations made to him by or on behalf of the owner or demise charterer within the period.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the end of the period referred to in subsection (4), the Director shall direct the Registrar to close the ship’s registration unless he is satisfied that it would be inappropriate to do so by any representations made pursuant to that subsection.
Upon receipt of a direction under subsection (5), the Registrar shall record the giving of the direction in the register and the ship’s registration shall thereupon be closed.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Issue of certificate of deletion
section.content: Where the registration of a ship is, or is deemed to be, closed under this Ordinance, the Registrar shall issue to the owner a certificate of deletion in the specified form certifying that the ship’s registration is closed and the date of such closure.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Delivery of certificate of registry on closure

subsection.leadIn: Upon the issue of a certificate of deletion in respect of a ship, the owner or master of the ship shall deliver the ship’s certificate of registry or certificate of provisional registry, as the case may be, or cause the certificate to be delivered, to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith, if the ship is in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the ship is not in Hong Kong, as soon as practicable and in any case within a period of 30 days after the date of issue of the certificate of deletion.

subsection.content: An owner or master who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

Where the registration of a ship is closed under this Part, the closure shall not affect any existing entry in the register so far as the entry relates to any undischarged registered mortgage of that ship or of any share in it.

subsection.def: In subsection (1) existing entry in the register (當時在註冊紀錄冊內的記載事項), in relation to a ship, means an entry existing in the register at the time of closure of the ship’s registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 11 the owner or demise charterer of a ship shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a person satisfying the requirements specified in subsection (2) to be the representative person in relation to the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that, so long as the ship remains registered, a person satisfying those requirements is appointed.

subsection.leadIn: The representative person must be— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 226)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a qualified person and the owner or part owner of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate incorporated in Hong Kong, or is a re-domiciled company, which is engaged in the business of managing, or acting as agent for, ships. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 226)

subsection.content: The owner or demise charterer of a ship in relation to which any representative person is for the time being appointed shall, in the event of any change in the identity, or in the address, of the representative person, notify the Registrar of the name and address of the new representative person, or (as the case may be) of the new address, within a period of 30 days after the change occurs.
The Registrar shall enter in the register particulars notified to him under subsection (3).
An owner or demise charterer who fails to comply with subsection (1)(b) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

section.name: s69
section.heading: Notice of change of business by representative person

subsection.content: A representative person appointed in relation to a ship (not being the owner of the ship) shall, in the event that he ceases to engage in the business of managing, or acting as agent for, ships, give notice in writing of that event to the Registrar and the owner or demise charterer within 30 days after the occurrence thereof.
A representative person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

section.name: s70
section.heading: Notice of intention to cease acting

subsection.leadIn: A representative person appointed in relation to a ship (not being the owner of the ship) who intends to cease acting as the representative person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice in writing of his intention to the owner or demise charterer of the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deposit with the Registrar a declaration that he has given such notice.

subsection.content: A notice given under subsection (1) shall have effect in accordance with section 71.

subsection.leadIn: The representative person appointed in relation to a ship shall represent the owner and demise charterer of a ship in respect of all matters concerning the ship’s operation as a registered ship and in particular, but without limiting the generality of the foregoing, shall, on behalf of the owner and demise charterer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accept service of all documents in respect of legal proceedings against the owner or demise charterer of the ship, which may be served on the representative person pursuant to section 88(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the Director or the Registrar by notice served on the owner, demise charterer or representative person requires the owner or demise charterer to take any action or give any information concerning the ship or the operation of the ship as a registered ship, take such action or give such information within the time specified in the notice or, if no such time is specified, within a reasonable time.

subsection.content: The duties prescribed by subsection (1) shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from any other duties prescribed in relation to a representative person by or under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where a representative person is appointed in relation to a ship, subsections (1) and (2) shall apply to that person until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment by the owner or demise charterer of another representative person in relation to the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiration of a period of 30 days after the date on which a declaration is deposited under section 70(1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration of the ship is closed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that person’s death, if an individual, or winding up or dissolution, as the case may be, if a body corporate,

subsection.continued: whichever event occurs first.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as making the representative person appointed in relation to a ship liable in any legal proceedings (whether civil or criminal) for any act or omission of the owner or demise charterer of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, if he is satisfied that the representative person for the time being appointed in relation to a ship (not being the owner of the ship)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not satisfy the requirements specified in section 68(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has failed to comply with section 71(1) or with any other obligation imposed on him as the representative person by this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: by written notice served on the owner or demise charterer and on the representative person, require the owner or demise charterer to replace the representative person within a period of 30 days after the date of service of the notice.

subsection.content: An owner or demise charterer who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

def.name: GovernmentShip
def.heading: Meaning of Government ship
def.content: In this Part Government ship (政府船舶) means a ship which is owned by the Government.

subsection.content: Subject to this Part, a Government ship is registrable.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, a registered Government ship ceases to be registrable if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it ceases to be a Government ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ship is taken in war or hostilities, as a result of which the Government has lost control over the operation of the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ship is broken up, or is an actual or constructive total loss such that it is no longer capable of being used in navigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship at the time of registration remains registered in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the ship subsequently becomes registered in a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Application for registration of Government ship
section.leadIn: An application for registration of a Government ship shall be made, in the specified form, by the Financial Secretary or by a public officer authorized by him for the purpose, and shall be accompanied by— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate of survey;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate or declaration of marking of the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: evidence, to the satisfaction of the Registrar, of deletion of the ship from the registry of the place outside Hong Kong where the ship was last registered (if any) or, if the ship was last registered concurrently in more than one such place, from the registry of each such place;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such evidence of title as is specified in instructions; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other documents or information as may be specified in instructions or as the Registrar may reasonably require.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Entry of particulars of Government ship in the register
section.leadIn: When the requirements of this Part preliminary to registration have been complied with in relation to a Government ship, the Registrar shall enter in the register the following particulars relating to the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such of the details specified in the certificate of survey as the Registrar considers essential for the purposes of registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars of the ship’s origin as stated in the application for registration; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Government as owner of the ship.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Certificate of registry of Government ship
section.content: Upon the registration of a Government ship under section 76, the Registrar shall grant a certificate of registry, in the specified form, containing particulars relating to the ship entered in the register pursuant to that section.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Retention of documents relating to Government ship
section.leadIn: Upon the registration of a Government ship under section 76, the Registrar shall retain in his possession the following documents in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application for registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate of survey;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the certificate or declaration of marking of the ship; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such evidence of title and other documents as are specified in instructions.

subsection.content: For the purposes of registration under this Ordinance, the transfer of a registered Government ship shall be effected by a bill of sale.

subsection.leadIn: The bill of sale shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: show the Government as transferor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be signed on behalf of the transferor by the Financial Secretary or by a public officer authorized by him for the purpose. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997; L.N. 144 of 2022)

section.name: s80
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to Government ships

subsection.content: In addition to the provisions of this Part, the provisions of this Ordinance specified in column 2 of Schedule 3 shall apply to Government ships to the extent provided in column 3 of that Schedule.
Except as provided by subsection (1) this Ordinance shall not apply to Government ships.
Nothing in this Ordinance shall make the Government liable to prosecution for an offence in relation to a Government ship.

section.name: s80A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IXA
section.def: listed certificate (表列證書) means—(a)a document listed in column 2 of the Table in Part 2 of Schedule 4A that is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document; or(b)a document listed in column 2 of that Table the subject matter of which is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Transport and Logistics.

section.name: s80B
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Part and Schedule 4A apply to a ship registered in Hong Kong.

section.name: s80C
section.heading: Listed certificates may be issued or granted electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate that may be issued or granted by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
A listed certificate may be issued or granted by a certifying authority in electronic form.
A listed certificate is considered as issued or granted in electronic form only if it is issued or granted in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.
A certifying authority must cause a listed certificate issued or granted by it in accordance with this section to be kept in the e-cert database.

section.name: s80D
section.heading: Listed certificates may be cancelled electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate that may be cancelled by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
A listed certificate may be cancelled by a certifying authority in electronic form.
A listed certificate is considered as cancelled in electronic form only if the cancellation is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.

If a listed certificate is cancelled in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up the certificate on its cancellation is regarded as having been met and physical delivery of the certificate is no longer required.
A certifying authority must cause a cancellation made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s80E
section.heading: Power of Secretary to amend Schedule 4A

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 4A.

A notice published under subsection (1) may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, savings or transitional provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of the amendments made under that subsection.

Where a registered ship is so altered as not to correspond with the particulars relating to the ship’s tonnage or description contained in the register, the owner, demise charterer or representative person shall give notice of the alteration to the Registrar in the specified form within 14 days after the completion of the alteration.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall, upon receipt of a notice under subsection (1), at his discretion either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the new particulars relating to the ship in the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require that the ship be registered anew.

subsection.content: Where notice under subsection (1) is not given in respect of a ship within the prescribed period, the obligation to give notice as required by that subsection continues, notwithstanding that the prescribed period has passed, until notice is so given.

Where there is a failure to comply with subsection (1) in relation to a ship, the owner or demise charterer commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2, and to a daily penalty of $1,000.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

Where under section 81 the Registrar requires that a ship be registered anew, he shall proceed as in the case of a first registration, and upon due compliance with the requirements as to first registration, or such of those requirements as are specified in instructions or as he may otherwise reasonably require, he shall register the ship anew.

subsection.leadIn: Where a ship is registered anew—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship’s former registration shall be deemed to be closed and section 67 shall apply as respects any undischarged registered mortgage of the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the names of all persons appearing on the former register to be interested in the ship as owners, demise charterers or mortgagees shall be entered on the new register and the registration anew shall not in any way affect the rights of any of those persons.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Grant of new certificate of registry

subsection.leadIn: Upon registration of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a change of name of a registered ship under section 17;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transfer of a registered ship or a share in or part of a ship under section 39 or 79;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars in respect of a transmission of property in a registered ship or a share in or part of the ship under section 42;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the change of address of an owner under section 54(3);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the particulars of a change in the identity or address of the representative person under section 68(3);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: new particulars of a registered ship after alteration of the ship under section 81 or upon registration anew under section 82; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other change in particulars relating to the ship, the owners, demise charterer or representative person pursuant to this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall grant a new certificate of registry of the ship, in the specified form, containing the new particulars relating to the ship, the owners, demise charterer or representative person, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the grant of a new certificate of registry of a registered ship under subsection (1) the owner, demise charterer or master shall deliver the old certificate of registry, or cause the certificate to be delivered, to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith, if the ship is in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the ship is not in Hong Kong, as soon as practicable and in any case within a period of 30 days after the date on which the new certificate is granted.

subsection.content: An owner, demise charterer or master who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)
This section applies in relation to a certificate of provisional registry as it applies in relation to a certificate of registry.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration under or for the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made in Hong Kong before the Registrar, a notary public, a commissioner for oaths or a solicitor; (Amended 47 of 1997 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made in a place outside Hong Kong before a notary public or such other person as may be specified for the purpose in instructions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may be made on behalf of a body corporate by the secretary or any other officer of the body corporate authorized by it for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: commissioner for oaths (監誓員) means a commissioner for oaths duly appointed by the Chief Justice under any enactment in force in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: notary public (公證人) in relation to Hong Kong, means a notary public as defined in section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159), and in relation to a place outside Hong Kong means a person duly authorized to take declarations under the law of that place. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 27 of 1998 s. 11)

section.name: s85
section.heading: Power of Registrar to dispense with declarations, etc.

subsection.content: Where under or for the purposes of this Ordinance a person is required to make a declaration on behalf of himself or of any body corporate, or any evidence is required to be produced to the Registrar, and it is shown to the satisfaction of the Registrar that from any reasonable cause that person is unable to make the declaration, or that the evidence cannot be produced, the Registrar may on the production of such evidence and subject to such terms as he thinks fit, dispense with the declaration or evidence.

Without prejudice to subsection (1), the Registrar may upon an application for registration of a ship under section 19, dispense with any declaration, evidence or consent under section 19, 20 or 21 to the extent that such declaration, evidence or consent has been made, produced or obtained, as the case may be, pursuant to an application for provisional registration of the ship under section 27.

section.name: s86
section.heading: False declarations or information
section.leadIn: Any person who, knowingly or recklessly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes any false declaration or certificate under or for the purposes of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes any false or misleading statement or furnishes any false or misleading information to the Director or Registrar pursuant to a requirement by or under this Ordinance to make any statement or furnish any information, whether in an application or otherwise,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

section.name: s87
section.heading: Documents, copies and admissibility in evidence

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of registry, certificate of provisional registry, other certificate or declaration issued or made under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of or extract from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the register in legible form; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a document referred to in paragraph (a),

paragraph.continued: and to be certified as a true copy or extract by the Registrar or a person authorized by him in that behalf,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in evidence in any legal proceedings upon its production unless it is proved that it is not the document it purports to be or that it was not signed or certified by the person by whom it purports to be signed or certified, as the case may be, and if so admitted shall be sufficient, but not conclusive, evidence of any matter stated in the register or document.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) shall prejudice the admissibility of any evidence which would be admissible apart from that subsection.

Without prejudice to section 8, the Registrar may in his discretion and on payment of the prescribed fee, supply a certified copy of or extract from any document forming part of or associated with the register to any person applying for such copy or extract.

A certification under subsection (3) relating to a copy of or extract from a listed certificate issued or granted in electronic form under Part IXA may be made in electronic form. (Added 24 of 2023 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: If a listed certificate is issued or granted in electronic form under Part IXA—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document referred to in subsection (1)(a) includes a printout of, and an electronic copy of, the listed certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case of a certification relating to a copy of or extract from the listed certificate made under subsections (3) and (4)—a document referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii) includes a printout of, and an electronic copy of, a copy of or extract from the listed certificate that is so certified. (Added 24 of 2023 s. 14)

subsection.content: If a certification relating to the register is made under section 8(2), a document referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) includes a printout of, and an electronic copy of, a copy of or extract from the register that is so certified. (Added 24 of 2023 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (4), (5) and (6)—
subsection.def: listed certificate (表列證書) has the meaning given by section 80A;
printout (打印本) includes a copy of a printout. (Added 24 of 2023 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Any notice required or authorized to be served on any person by the Director or Registrar under this Ordinance shall be deemed to be duly served on that person if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivered to him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sent to him by registered post at the address for the time being recorded in relation to him in the register or otherwise notified to the Registrar pursuant to a duty under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: left at that address.

subsection.content: Any document required or authorized, by virtue of any statutory provision, to be served for the purpose of the institution of, or otherwise in connection with, proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance or any Ordinance specified in Schedule 2 shall, where the person to be served is the owner or demise charterer of a registered ship, be deemed to be duly served on the owner or demise charterer if it is served, in the manner prescribed by subsection (1), on the representative person appointed in relation to the ship.

subsection.leadIn: Any document required or authorized by virtue of any statutory provision, to be served for the purpose of the institution of, or otherwise in connection with, proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, on the master of a ship, shall be deemed to be duly served on the master if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivered to him; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: left on board the ship with a person being or appearing to be in command or charge of the ship.

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs the service under this Ordinance of a document on the master of a ship commits an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

Any owner, demise charterer, master or representative person of a ship who is party or privy to a contravention of subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

Where a ship detained under section 17 or 18 goes to sea or attempts to go to sea before it is released from detention by the Director, the master and the owner or demise charterer commit an offence and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Where a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: goes to sea in contravention of subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has on board a public officer acting in the execution of his duty,

subsection.continued: the master and the owner or demise charterer—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: commit an offence and each is liable, in addition to any penalty to which he may be liable under subsection (1), to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and to an additional fine of $1,000 for each day during the period from the date on which the ship proceeded to sea until the date on which the officer is returned to Hong Kong or, if he does not return directly to Hong Kong, would have returned if he had travelled by the quickest practicable route; and(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: are jointly and severally liable to pay all expenses incidental to the taking of the officer to sea and to securing his return to Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: and all such expenses may be recovered in the same manner as a fine.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations providing for or in relation to— (Amended 64 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fees for the registration and provisional registration of ships and for matters relating thereto, for the issue of certificates of registry, certificates of provisional registry and other documents under the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annual tonnage charges in respect of registered ships;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fees for transfers and transmissions of ships and ship mortgages;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: fees for inspecting the register and for copies of or extracts from entries in the register or copies of or extracts from any certificate or other document forming part of or associated with the register, and for certification of such copies or extracts;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: fees for any matter in respect of which regulations may be made under section 13 or 16.

subsection.leadIn: Any fees or charges prescribed under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be fixed at levels which provide for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government or other authority in relation generally to the administration, regulation and control of ports, ships and navigation in the waters of Hong Kong, and shall not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in the provision of any particular service, facility or matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), be fixed at different amounts in relation to different sizes of ship, whether measured by tonnage, length or otherwise, or in relation to different classes, types or descriptions of ship, service, facility or matter.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1) may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reduction, waiver or refund of fees or charges in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exemption of any ship or class, type or description of ships from the payment of any fee or charge; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for any such exemption to be granted by the Director or the Registrar.

subsection.content: Fees or charges payable pursuant to regulations made under subsection (1) may be recovered from the owner or demise charterer in the District Court as a civil debt, notwithstanding that the amount is in excess of the sum mentioned in section 33 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

section.name: s91
section.heading: References to ship registered in Hong Kong
section.content: A reference in any Ordinance to a ship registered in Hong Kong shall be construed as a reference to a ship registered or provisionally registered under this Ordinance.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.text: The Chief Executive may by order published in the Gazette amend any Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Time limit for criminal proceedings
section.content: An information or complaint relating to an offence under this Ordinance or any regulations made under this Ordinance shall be laid or made within 2 years from the commission of the offence.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XI
section.content: In this Part, Act (法令) means the Merchant Shipping Act 1894 (1894 c. 60 U.K.)* as applied in or extended to Hong Kong immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: in relation to the Merchant Shipping Act 1894, Part 3 of Schedule 5 to Cap. 415 and s. 1 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 508;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: in relation to the Merchant Shipping Acts 1894 to 1979, s. 117 of Cap. 281, s. 103 of Cap. 415 and s. 142 of Cap. 478.
Every ship that was, immediately before the commencement date, registered in Hong Kong under the Act, shall be deemed on and from that date to be registered under this Ordinance.

Any entry or record that, immediately before the commencement date, appeared in a register book kept in Hong Kong under the Act in relation to a ship referred to in subsection (1) shall be deemed to be an entry or record in the register kept under section 7 in relation to that ship and to have been made on the date on which, and at the time when, it was made under the Act.

subsection.leadIn: Any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mortgage or other instrument relating to a ship referred to in subsection (1) made in accordance with the Act and in force immediately before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: endorsement, memorandum or other note made in accordance with the Act on any such mortgage or other instrument and in force immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: has effect on and after that date as if it had been made in accordance with the corresponding provision (if any) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Ships not yet registered under the Act

subsection.leadIn: Where in relation to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for registration of the ship in Hong Kong under the Act was made before the commencement date and, immediately before that date, was not yet determined; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements of the Act preliminary to such registration have been complied with,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the application shall be deemed to be an application for registration of the ship under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the ship shall be deemed to be registrable; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the requirements of this Ordinance preliminary to registration shall be deemed to have been complied with.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) shall affect any liability to pay any fee or charge pursuant to regulations made under section 90.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Entry of particulars in respect of transitional ships

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall enter in the register the following particulars relating to a ship deemed to be registered under section 95(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such of the details of the ship recorded in the register book kept under the Act as the Registrar considers essential for the purposes of registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars of the ship’s origin as recorded in the register book kept under the Act; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name, address and description of each owner and a statement of the number of shares in the ship owned by each.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall enter in the register the following particulars relating to a ship referred to in section 96—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such of the details specified in the surveyor’s certificate granted under the Act as the Registrar considers essential for the purposes of registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars of the ship’s origin as stated in the declaration of ownership made under the Act; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name, address and description of each owner and a statement of the number of shares in the ship owned by each.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Certificate of registry for transitional ships

subsection.content: Upon the entry in the register of particulars of a ship under section 97, the Registrar shall grant a certificate of registry, in the specified form, containing those particulars.

Until such time as a certificate of registry is granted under this section in respect of a ship referred to in section 95(1), the certificate of registry granted under the Act in respect of the ship shall for the purposes of this Ordinance and the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281) be treated as a certificate of registry granted under this section.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Retention of documents for transitional ships
section.leadIn: Upon the entry in the register of particulars of a ship under section 97, the Registrar shall retain in his possession in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the surveyor’s certificate granted under the Act;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the builder’s certificate, bill of sale in favour of the owner or court order vesting title to the ship in the owner, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the copy of the condemnation (if any); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all declarations of ownership made under the Act.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Return of certificates issued under the Act

subsection.leadIn: Upon the grant of a certificate of registry under section 98 in respect of a ship referred to in section 95(1), the owner or master of the ship shall deliver the certificate of registry granted under the Act in respect of the ship, or cause such certificate to be delivered, to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith if the ship is in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the ship is not in Hong Kong, as soon as practicable and in any case within a period of 30 days after the grant of the certificate of registry under section 98.

subsection.content: An owner or master who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.(Amended E.R. 1 of 2022)

section.name: s101
section.heading: Transitional ship ceasing to be registrable
section.leadIn: A ship registered or deemed to be registered under this Part ceases to be registrable if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship or any share in the ship is transferred or transmitted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ship is taken in war or hostilities, as a result of which the owner has lost control over the operation of the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ship is broken up, or is an actual or constructive total loss such that it is no longer capable of being used in navigation; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship subsequently becomes registered in a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to transitional ships

subsection.content: In addition to the provisions of this Part, the provisions of this Ordinance specified in column 2 of Schedule 4 shall apply, to the extent and in the manner provided in column 3 of that Schedule, to ships registered or deemed to be registered under this Part.
Except as provided by subsection (1) this Ordinance shall not apply to ships registered or deemed to be registered under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Merchant Shipping (Tonnage) Regulations (App. I, p. AB 1*) amended in the provisions set out in column 2 of Part 1 of Schedule 5, to the extent set out in column 3 of that Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, notwithstanding the repeals under subsection (3), continue in operation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be deemed for all purposes to have been made by the Chief Executive in Council under section 13. (Amended 64 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.content: A Certificate of British Tonnage Measurement or British Tonnage Certificate issued under the Merchant Shipping (Tonnage) Regulations (App. I, p. AB 1†) and in force immediately prior to the commencement date shall continue in force and have effect as if it were a Certificate of Hong Kong Tonnage Measurement or Hong Kong Tonnage Certificate (as the case may be) issued under those regulations as amended by subsection (1).
The enactments specified in Part 3 of Schedule 5 are repealed.

Section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) shall apply in relation to the repeal of a provision of an United Kingdom enactment effected by this section as it applies in relation to the repeal of a provision of an Ordinance.

editorialNote.content: * See now Cap. 415 sub. leg. C.
† See App. I, p. AB1, 1983 R. Edition.

schedule.text: The national flag of the People’s Republic of China flown directly above the regional flag of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.
